input: Charlie is kind. Erin is blue. Erin is furry. Erin is kind. Erin is quiet. Gary is furry. Gary is red. Harry is big. Harry is furry. Harry is kind. Harry is nice. Harry is quiet. Nice, big things are quiet. If something is blue then it is big. All big, red things are kind. Big things are kind. Red, kind things are nice. If something is red then it is blue. If something is quiet and kind then it is big. If Erin is nice and Erin is big then Erin is red. Question: Gary is quiet.?
output:
universe u

constant obj : Type u

constant Charlie : obj
constant Erin : obj
constant Gary : obj
constant Harry : obj

constant Kind : obj → Prop
constant Blue : obj → Prop
constant Furry : obj → Prop
constant Quiet : obj → Prop
constant Red : obj → Prop
constant Big : obj → Prop
constant Nice : obj → Prop

axiom T1 : Kind Charlie
axiom T2 : Blue Erin
axiom T3 : Furry Erin
axiom T4 : Kind Erin
axiom T5 : Quiet Erin
axiom T6 : Furry Gary
axiom T7 : Red Gary
axiom T8 : Big Harry
axiom T9 : Furry Harry
axiom T10 : Kind Harry
axiom T11 : Nice Harry
axiom T12 : Quiet Harry

axiom R1 : ∀ x : obj, Nice x ∧ Big x → Quiet x
axiom R2 : ∀ x : obj, Blue x → Big x
axiom R3 : ∀ x : obj, Big x ∧ Red x → Kind x
axiom R4 : ∀ x : obj, Big x → Kind x
axiom R5 : ∀ x : obj, Red x ∧ Kind x → Nice x
axiom R6 : ∀ x : obj, Red x → Blue x
axiom R7 : ∀ x : obj, Quiet x ∧ Kind x → Big x
axiom R8 : Nice Erin ∧ Big Erin → Red Erin

theorem gary_is_quiet : Quiet Gary :=
begin
  apply R1,
  split,
  apply R5,
  split,
  exact T7,
  apply R3,
  split,
  apply R2,
  apply R6,
  exact T7,
  exact T7,
  apply R2,
  apply R6,
  exact T7,
end

-- The answer is True
